# Project Learnings

Observations captured by CHAOS sessions. Patterns appearing 3+ times get promoted to `standards/`.

---

## 2026-01-15 — setup-auth

- **Observation**: The codebase uses a centralized error hierarchy in `src/utils/errors.ts`
- **Context**: Tried creating a new AuthError class directly. Reviewer pointed to existing hierarchy.
- **Recommendation**: Always extend the base AppError class from src/utils/errors.ts for new error types

## 2026-01-18 — add-payment

- **Observation**: Payment service errors needed to follow the existing error hierarchy
- **Context**: Created PaymentError extending AppError. Fit perfectly with existing error handler.
- **Recommendation**: Always extend the base AppError class from src/utils/errors.ts for new error types

## 2026-01-22 — notification-service

- **Observation**: Notification failures needed structured error handling
- **Context**: The middleware in src/middleware/errorHandler.ts only catches AppError subclasses
- **Recommendation**: Always extend the base AppError class from src/utils/errors.ts for new error types

## 2026-01-25 — api-validation

- **Observation**: Input validation uses the shared InputValidator in src/utils/
- **Context**: Each domain has specific validation but they all use the same base class
- **Recommendation**: Check src/utils/ for existing utility classes before creating new ones

## 2026-01-28 — user-profile

- **Observation**: Profile update needed validation and used InputValidator
- **Context**: Extending InputValidator was straightforward and consistent with existing code
- **Recommendation**: Check src/utils/ for existing utility classes before creating new ones
